snippet: A study of 62 patients with chronic cough in Australia found that those given gabapentin, an anticonvulsant, saw a decline in severity and frequency of coughing.
abstract: A study of 62 patients with chronic cough in Australia found that those given gabapentin, an anticonvulsant, saw a decline in severity and frequency of coughing.

headline.print_headline: Vital Signs | Regimens: Anticonvulsant May Relieve Chronic Cough
